description: An iconic ancient amphitheatre, the Colosseum is a symbol of Imperial Rome and one of the world's most recognizable landmarks, known for its gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.
name: Colosseum

description: The famous bell tower of the Pisa Cathedral, known worldwide for its unintended tilt, offers a unique photo opportunity and a chance to climb to the top for panoramic views of Pisa.
name: Leaning Tower of Pisa

description: The largest church in the world and a central site of Catholicism, St. Peter's Basilica is an architectural masterpiece featuring works by Michelangelo and Bernini, serving as a significant pilgrimage destination.
name: St. Peter's Basilica

description: Housed in a historic building in Florence, the Uffizi Gallery is one of the oldest and most famous art museums in the world, renowned for its unparalleled collection of Renaissance masterpieces.
name: Uffizi Gallery

description: The oldest and most iconic bridge spanning the Grand Canal in Venice, the Rialto Bridge is a bustling landmark offering picturesque views of the city's waterways and gondolas.
name: Rialto Bridge

description: An ancient Roman city preserved under volcanic ash from Mount Vesuvius, Pompeii offers a remarkable insight into daily life over two millennia ago, with remarkably intact buildings, frescoes, and artifacts.
name: Pompeii Archaeological Park
